articles.author: Express Web Desk
articles.title: Oropouche virus surge in Brazil: Experts warn of escalating threat - The Indian Express
articles.description: In June, a pregnant woman lost her baby at 30 weeks, and the virus was detected in samples from the umbilical cord and organs.
articles.content: The Oropouche virus, spread by midges and mosquitoes, has seen a dramatic rise in Brazil this year, with 7,284 cases reported, up from 832 in 2023. This sharp increase is raising alarms among experts… [+2704 chars]
